messages: 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:55): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: yeah, looks good. Probably should drop the "no references" thing though since now the dfns are basically references.
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (08:56): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: what about "no other references" maybe?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:56): i dunno that it even needs to be there at all, i mean, if you're looking up a term in an index, and there's only one reference, that's ok
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (08:57): I will it so
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:57): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: not sure what to do about the conflicting terms... "align" in particular looks weird
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (08:57): I will make it so
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (08:57): yeah
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (08:57): that's one of the downsides
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (08:58): I can maybe work on figuring out how to merge those
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:58): "command" is similarly kind of a disaster
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:58): there's four of them and even i don't know which is which :-)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:58): oh you know what would be cool? if you could detect if the <dfn>ing instance used <code> or not
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:59): so that elements got styled "correctly" in the index
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:59): dunno how easy that would be
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (08:59): that's doable
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (08:59): that's easy
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:59): cool
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:59): this is awesome, i really love this index
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (08:59): I think I could also deal with the align. command, etc., stuff by having anolis do another pass on the contents
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:00): can't wait to see what it looks like for complete.html :-D
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (09:00): and merging stuff
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (09:00): yeah
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (09:00): I will say that this is going to slow down your build/checkin times
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (09:00): when you make changes
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (09:00): dunno if you care
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:00): a lot of the duplicates are in the non-conforming section, which makes merging them ok
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:00): it's the other ones i'm worried about
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:00): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: does it slow down anolis? Or just the splitter?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:00): or what?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (09:01): anolis, mainly.. on my machine it takes about 6 minutes to have it build the author view
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:01): oh yikes
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (09:02): there might be some way I can speed it up, I dunno
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:02): maybe we can have the spec splitters do the anolis pass as well
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (09:02): yeah

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:02): right now i subcontract out to jgraham's pimpmyspec for the anolis part, get one file back, then subcontract out to annevk and Philip`'s spec splitters, which send be tarballs back.
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (09:03): yeah
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:03): but if i could just send a source file to anne and Philip` that would work fine for me too
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (09:03): that can be combined for sure
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:03): well i only do the splitting once i checkin at the moment
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (09:03): it's all python
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (09:03): ah, OK
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:03): and the anolis part when i regen
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (09:03): I see
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (09:04): the anolis part was not terrifically fast before anyway
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (09:04): I can't remember how long it took but it was a minute or two, it seemed like
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (09:04): the splitter is much faster
b844a0a98f81c321afe1d38ae37f3c28 (09:27): channel #whatwg
